title: Petrol & Diesel tankers reach Sri Lanka
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) stated that 40,000 MT of Diesel is being unloaded at its Kolonnawa storage premises.
The Chairman of the CPC, Attorney-at-Law Sumith Wijesinghe stated that another vessel carrying 90,000L of crude oil is scheduled to arrive in the country on Tuesday (26).
In addition, two more vessels carrying Petrol and Diesel have arrived in the country.
The CPC Chairman further said that the vessel would be funded on a priority basis by managing dollars.
